pages.text:
Membership Benefits
Chamber membership offers an array of benefits to fit the different needs of our member businesses.
Minding YOUR Business
Connect and Collaborate
As a Chamber member, you can meet, collaborate and connect with a diverse membership base of over 900 members to expand your business and personal contacts.
Advocacy and Support
The Chamber advocates for business in the community offering a united voice at the local, state, and national levels. We also strive to provide information and support to assist members at any stage of their business journey.
Uplift Your Staff
Your Chamber membership lets your employees get engaged too! Chamber member staff are eligible to receive all membership benefits and access to events and programs, all while promoting YOUR BUSINESS.Â
On the Web
We encourage all Chamber members to keep us informed of any events, specials, and promotions. We are happy to spread your message to our vast online following and email subscribers. Email all of your exciting news and/or upcoming events to PR@CitrusCountyChamber.com to utilize our online marketing benefits.
Create a Buzz
The Chamber will host a ribbon cutting at your business to announce your membership. The Chamber will also help to promote all future events and accomplishments. Email all of your exciting news and/or upcoming events to PR@CitrusCountyChamber.com to utilize our marketing benefits.
Giving Back
The Chamber uses funds to give back to many local organizations and facilitates connections with local business owners and non-profit entities that uplift those in need in our community.
Want to learn more about the benefits and ROI of Chamber membership? Email or call Corrine Sachewicz at Corrine@CitrusCountyChamber.com | 352-795-3149

Leadership Citrus
Leadership Citrus, âa Citrus County Chamber Committee, is an annual program designed to enhance the leadership potential of individuals living in Citrus County who are involved in business, professional and community service activities.
Through an intense program of lectures and structured activities, participants will become familiar with current issues, community resources and other factors influencing the quality of life and direction of Citrus County's future.
Founded in 1991, Leadership Citrus is a highly successful community leadership program which brings together individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences from both the public and private sectors. The Leadership Citrus program is designed for those who have demonstrated the talent, interest and desire required for involvement in community leadership roles.
Through discussion and interaction with established community leaders, as well as various experts, participants will have a unique opportunity to examine the social, political and economic factors affecting community life. This program holds unlimited potential for enhancing our community by preparing and motivating its participants.
We invite you to be a part of this unique educational opportunity.
2025 Class Schedule:
January 8 - Welcome
June 12 - Class
January 9 - Teambuilding
July 10 - Class
February 6 - Class
August 14 - Class
March 6 - Class
September 11 - Class
March 20 - Legislative Day
October 9 - Class
April 10 - Class
November 13 - Class
May 8 - Class
November 14 - Graduation
APPLY NOW!
Application Deadline: November 1st, 2024
Participation Fees:
Chamber Member: $650
Non-Chamber Member: $750
Qualifying 501(c)3 Charitable Organizations (Chamber Member): $550
â
*Please note fees are all inclusive for class activity costs, lunches, and refreshments as needed.

Advocacy and Business Support Services
The Chamber advocates for business in the community offering a united voice at the local, state, and national levels. We also strive to provide information and support to assist members at any stage of their business journey.
Advocacy and Business Support
Annual Citrus County Legislative Day in Tallahassee
Direct connection with local & state representatives
Advocate regarding new/changing regulations, taxes, and mandates that affect your business
Mobile office access to state and federal legislative staff
Member-to-member patronage/discounts
Member referrals
Business training/development resources
Individualized business advice and consultations
Business retention and expansion services
Please direct all advocacy and Business retention/expansion inquiries to Chamber VP/BRE, Ardath Prendergast, at Ardath@CitrusCountyChamber.com.
All member support service requests can be directed to Member Relations Manager, Corrine Sachewicz, at Corrine@CitrusCountyChamber.com

Citrus County Chamber of Commerce
915 N. Suncoast Boulevard
Crystal River, FL 34429
(352) 795-3149
events@citruscountychamber.com
Powered By
GrowthZone

About Us
The Chamber isâ¦
Voice for Business
The Chamber is an advocate for business in the community and offers a united voice for their interests at the local, state, and national levels. From influencing local policy to advocating for national business issues, we have the resources to bring your concerns to a larger audience.
As a lead organizing member of the Citrus Business Alliance, the Chamber works closely with our other local trade associations, colleges, business development organizations, and key industry partners as well as our local governments to listen to the needs of our businesses and strive to find and implement practical solutions.
Asset for Professional Networking
The Chamber hosts 11 luncheons per year in which we invite prominent guest speakers to talk about varying topics significant to businesses in Citrus County.Â  Chamber members host 11 mixers per year providing excellent opportunities to exchange business information, form relationships, and have fun mingling with other members.Â  We average over 100 ribbon cuttings per year and have grown to close to 1,000 members to date.Â  In addition the Chamber offers numerous workshops and produces two major festivals each year. All of these events provide outstanding opportunities for business owners, employees, and the public to get engaged! Check the online Chamber Calendar for up-to-date event listings!
Chamber Mission & Vision
Our Mission
The Citrus County Chamber of Commerce is an organization of businesses unified in efforts to advance the economic growth of the region, promote the interests of the business community, provide leadership on key commerce issues and preserve the county's quality of life.
Our Vision
The Citrus County Chamberâs vision is to make Citrus County a great place to live, work and play.Â  To support this vision the Chamber has united key partners, scheduled an ambitious calendar of networking events, and works closely with media partners to bring attention to the business community.
The Chamber is part of the Citrus County Business Resource Alliance, which is a group of key business organizations that are working together to improve the economic climate of the community through each groupâs specialized area of service.

Chamber Leadership
Chamber Staff
Josh Wooten
President & CEO
Send Email
Read Bio
Josh Wooton
President & CEO
Josh Wooten, a Florida native who has called Citrus County home since 1984, brings a lifelong commitment to community service and economic growth. A former Citrus County Commissioner and small-business owner, Josh was appointed President/CEO of the Citrus County Chamber of Commerce in March 2009.
Over the years, he has lent his leadership to a wide range of boards and advisory committees, including the Citrus Memorial Hospital Advisory Board, the Florida Sheriff Youth Ranch Board of Directors, and the Board of County Commissioners Stakeholders Advisory Group. He helped found Keep Citrus County Beautiful, is a life member of the Citrus County Historical Society, and previously served as State Commander of the Sons of the American Legion. His passion for conservation has also placed him on several regional water boards and environmental advisory groups.
Most recently, Josh was elected to the Board of the Florida Association of Chamber Professionals and appointed to the College of Central Florida â Citrus Campus Advisory Committee, expanding his influence on workforce development and state and regional collaboration.
Josh is the proud father of four daughters and grandfather to four grandchildren, all of whom inspire his dedication to preserving the quality of life in Citrus County.
Ardath Prendergast
Vice President of Operations and Business Retention & Expansion
Send Email
Read Bio
Ardath Prendergast
Vice President of Operations and Business Retention & Expansion
Ardath Prendergast has been a Chamber employee since 2011 and is presently Vice President / Operations & BRE. A graduate of the University of Central Florida with degrees in Allied Legal Services and Criminal Justice, Ardath specialized as an aviation paralegal in Dallas and Washington, DC.Â  However, her childhood passion had always been dance and the arts - so when she moved to Atlanta, she switched over to the nonprofit world of arts and disability, and became the arts manager of the Arts Festival of Atlanta, executive director of the National Association of Independent Artists (NAIA) and also co-founded Full Radius Dance, a professional company of dancers with and without disabilities.Â  In 2004, Ardath made full circle back to Florida, re-discovered the wonder of Floridaâs outdoors, fell in love with our Citrus County community and insists she is never leaving Florida again!
Corrine Sachewicz
Member Relations Manager
Send Email
Read Bio
Corrine Sachewicz
Member Relations Manager
Corrine joined the Chamber in 2017 and is presently our âMember Relations Manager.Â  She is the Liaison to the Business Women's Alliance (BWA), the Ambassadors and Chamber Board of Directors.Â  One of her strengths is building relationships within the community. After earning a B.S. in Marketing Management from Trenton State College, she worked extensively with Fortune 500 companies as an Account Manager with a Marketing firm for over 18 years. Corrine is a proud and dedicated mother to her two young adult children who she raised in Citrus County.Â  Throughout most of their schooling, she served on several Gifted Advisory Boards, SAEC committees, volunteered in the classroom and coached Odyssey of the Mind.Â  She has a fabulous green thumb and is passionate about nature and kayaking.Â  She likes to use her creative talents whenever possible.
Jade White
Public Relations & Communications Manager
Send Email
Read Bio
Jade White
Public Relations & Communications Manager
Jade WhiteÂ is the Public Relations & Communications Manager for the Citrus County Chamber of Commerce, where she directs strategic messaging, media outreach, and marketing for the Chamberâs signature events. Backed by more than 15 years in communications, Jade serves as the organizationâs primary brand steward, ensuring consistent, communityâfocused engagement across all channels.
Deeply involved in civic life, Jade sits on the Board of the Boys & Girls Clubs of Citrus County and acts as liaison to the Chamber Young Professionals Committee. In recognition of her impact, she was named on of Citrus Countyâs â40â¯Underâ¯Fortyâ recipients inâ¯2022.
A Citrus County resident since 2003 and graduate of Lecanto High School, Jade is completing an A.S. in Business Administration while raising her daughter and stepson with her husband and high school sweetheart.
Luzviminda Rivetz
Administrative Coordinator
Send Email
Read Bio
Luzviminda Rivetz
Administrative Coordinator
Luzviminda Rivetz recently joined the Chamber team in March 2023 as the Administrative Coordinator. She comes from a background in Business Management Marketing and Administration and Business Management Information Systems. She has lived in Florida for most of her adult life. She migrated from the Island of the Philippines in 1995. She enjoys hiking, gardening, and photography.
Cynthia Oswald
Program Support Specialist
Send Email
Read Bio
Cynthia Oswald
Program Support Specialist
Cynthiaâs leadership journey began in New York, serving as the executive director of the Livingston County Business Education Alliance (BEA), a nonprofit dedicated to providing career awareness programs for the emerging workforce, after years in the education sector with experience in everything from preschool to college faculty. After a successful tenure leading the BEA Cynthia was hired as the first woman president and CEO of the Livingston County Area Chamber of Commerce (LCACC). During her time at the chamber, she led the chamberâs 501c3 affiliate the Livingston County Education Alliance (LCEA) and held the county contract for tourism and the Visitor and Convention Bureau (VCB), along with overseeing the construction of the new chamber offices and visitor center. While in New York Cynthia was appointed to the U.S. Chamberâs Small Business Council in Washington, D.C. and Governor Cuomoâs Regional Economic Council and executive committee. She served as vice-chairwoman for the Chamber Alliance of New York State (CANYS), chaired the local United Way campaign and was named Livingston County Business Person of the Year by the New York State Department of Labor. Cynthia has also worked in international economic development in Europe, China, and Africa. She received the Excellence in Community Development award from the New Juaben, Ghana traditional ruler Dassabre Oti Boateng for her work supporting the creation of the first chamber of commerce and business women leadership group in the region. Throughout her career the end-game was always to relocate to Citrus County after discovering the county over thirty years ago when her parents moved to Crystal River as snowbirds. Landing here in 2016 to work as the Citrus County Public Information Officer (PIO) was the perfect position giving her a crash course in county history, culture, and amenities. Life has come full circle for Cynthia, in semi-retirement she is happy to be back in the chamber world as program support specialist for the Citrus County Chamber of Commerce two days a week. Cynthia has a BA in Human Services from the State University of New York (SUNY) and a certificate in nonprofit organizational management from the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Northeast Institute at Villanova University.

Judy Knowlton
Administrative Assistant - Inverness
Judy Knowlton has worked for the Chamber since 2015 as an Administrative Assistant in the Inverness office. She graduated from Jamestown Business College as a Medical Assistant and worked Lutheran Social Services in youth services for ten years beginning in 1968. In 1983, as an Certified Activity Director, started the programming for Chautauqua Adult Care in New York State where she found her love in working in dementia and memory care and stayed for the next 20 years. She fell in love with Florida after visiting on vacation, and left New York behind to live happily in Inverness in 2003. After arriving, one of her most gratifying work experiences was being Director of Volunteer Services for Hospice of Citrus and the Nature Coast where she trained administrative and patient support volunteers to provide services to those with needs at end of life. Her work life within the human service field has been very fulfilling. She also enjoys performing in amateur theater. â

Missy Slanker
Special Events Manager
Melissa (Missy) Slanker joined the Chamber team in 2022 and is presently the Special Events Manager. Although not originally native to Citrus County, she has resided here since 2007. Missy and her husband, Bobby started Sound Decisions in 2015 and joined the Citrus County Chamber of Commerce in 2017. Shortly after joining the Chamber, she became an Ambassador. She has a background in business since 2000 and earned her Associateâs Degree from Remington College. She currently sits on the board for United Way and Kings Bay Rotary. She enjoys connecting with the public and is always willing to go out of her way to help with projects, ribbon cuttings, mixers, luncheons, and fundraisers along with being a business owner, a wife, a mom of 5, and a Mimsie to 3 grandchildren.

Bridget Humenik
Office Specialist
A proud Citrus County native, Bridget Humenik joined the Chamber in May 2025 following a three-month internship through the College of Central Florida. After earning her BAS in Business and Organizational Management, she was brought on as an Office Specialist. In her role, Bridget is committed to fostering meaningful connections and supporting the growth of the local business community. Passionate about personal and professional development, Bridget continues to use her skills to make a positive impact every day. Outside of work, she enjoys reading, exploring the arts, and is currently learning to play the piano.

Stacey Worthington
Chair
Worthington AC & Heathing
Raised in Citrus County, FL, I ventured out of my hometown after high school to pursue higher education and a career in the pharmaceutical industry. The deep-rooted connections of family, the warmth of community, and the undeniable charm of Homosassa called me back home in 2010. Today, I proudly serve as the Chair of the Citrus County Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors and as a member of the Governmental Affairs Committee, working to strengthen and support our local business community.
In 2020, the Board of County Commissioners nominated me to the Planning and Development Commission, where I focused on crafting strategic, managed growth policies and modernizing our countyâs comprehensive plan. My term ended in January 2024 and I look forward to using the knowledge and experience I gained in future endeavors.
My passion for advocating on behalf of small businesses and the construction industry led me to serve as Presidentânow Treasurerâof the Citrus County Building Alliance. Alongside my husband, I also run Worthington A/C & Heating, a local small business dedicated to serving our community.

Rob Wardlow
Treasurer
Wardlow & Cash, PA
Rob is a Florida native and lifetime resident, who was born in Hernando County and is currently a resident of Citrus County. He graduated from the University of South Florida in 1991 and has been a Certified Public Account since 1994. Joining Wardlow & Cash, P.A. in 1993, Rob became a partner in 1996. He has over 25 years in governmental accounting and auditing experience. Rob is an active member in the community and has been affiliated with the Citrus County Chamber, Early Learning Coalition and others. Rob enjoys spending time with wife, children and grandchildren along with being on the water and is an avid fisherman.

Kelley Paul
Secretary
Wollinka Wikle Title Insurance
ââKelley is a Florida native who was born in Crystal River and is a current resident of Citrus County. She graduated from Crystal River High School and furthered her education at the College of Central Florida. She has her AS degree in Computer & Information Technology and is a Licensed Title Insurance Agent and Certified Land Closer. Kelley has two children, Christian and Jesse, which keep her busy at YMCA basketball, CRLL baseball, and NC football games. She has worked at Wollinka Wikle Title Insurance since 2011 and is an active member of Gulf to Lake Church, Citrus County Chamber, and the Builders Alliance.
